item.title: Dataset descriptor and RDF representations
item.description: The Registry now provides a dataset descriptor and RDF representations of the whole Registry and individual data collections (in RDF/XML and Turtle formats). Read more about this news.

item.title: Primary resources
item.description: As requested by a number of our users, Identifiers.org and its Registry now highlight the "primary resource" for data collections. This represents the resource that is maintained by the provider of the original data, and thereby acknowledges the original source. Please note that not all data collections have a primary resource; for example where multiple collaborating institutes are equally responsible, no primary resource is specified.

item.title: New design for the Registry
item.description: Launch of the new design of the Registry. By following new guidelines and simplifying the interface, we hope this will make the resource more accessible to all.

item.title: Identifiers.org at SWAT4LS 2012
item.description: Identifiers.org and its Registry were presented during the 2012 edition of SWAT4LS. Proceedings (including our position paper) are available from CEUR.

item.title: Identifiers.org at COMBINE 2012
item.description: Identifiers.org and the MIRIAM Registry were presented at the COMBINE meeting in Toronto, Canada. The presentation is available here, and a poster here.

item.title: MiriamJavaLib version 1.1.5
item.description: Release of the version 1.1.5 of the Java library, available from SourceForge and the EBI Maven repository.

item.title: Web Services updated
item.description: Web Services updated in order to allow the conversion of Identifiers.org URLs into their equivalent MIRIAM URIs. Cf. the documentation for more information. Batch queries are also available.

item.title: MiriamJavaLib version 1.1.4
item.description: Release of the version 1.1.4 of the Java library, available from SourceForge and the EBI Maven repository.

item.title: Web Services updated
item.description: Web Services updated in order to allow the conversion of MIRIAM URIs into their equivalent Identifiers.org URLs. Cf. the documentation for more information. Batch queries are also available.

item.title: Updated XML export and its schema
item.description: The XML export and XML Schema have been updated. For each data collection, the XML export now includes various new elements such as the namespace, the root Identifiers.org URL or the list of restrictions (if any recorded).

item.title: Data collections with restrictions on some of their potential usages
item.description: Introduction of a mechanism to state specific restrictions associated with certain data collections. These restrictions include restricted licenses (which for example may preclude the use of a data collection by commercial organisations) and non-stable identifiers (which for example may differ for a specific record between releases or versions of a data collection). The introduction of this system will enable us to publish data collections that were previously not compliant with the Registry's requirements. However, although this will ensure provision of URIs for records provided by those data collections, the level of support and services (such as the resolution one) may be affected. We welcome feedback on this recent development, and suggestions for its future refinement.

item.title: Identifiers.org and MIRIAM Registry: community resources to provide persistent identification
item.description: Identifiers.org and MIRIAM Registry: community resources to provide persistent identification published. In this paper, we describe the MIRIAM Registry, which provides unique, perennial and location-independent identifiers for data used in the biomedical domain. We also introduce the new Identifiers.org service that is built upon the information stored in the Registry and which provides directly resolvable identifiers, in the form of Uniform Resource Locators (URLs). The flexibility of the identification scheme and resolving system allows its use in many different fields, where unambiguous and perennial identification of data entities are necessary.

item.title: MiriamJavaLib version 1.1.3
item.description: Release of the version 1.1.3 of the Java library, available from SourceForge and the EBI Maven repository.

item.title: Web Services updated
item.description: Web Services updated in order to allow batch queries for getting MIRIAM URIs. Cf. the documentation for more information.

item.title: MIRIAM Resources renamed MIRIAM Registry
item.description: In order to prevent confusion when talking about MIRIAM Resources and the concept of "resource", we decided to rename the whole infrastructure MIRIAM Registry.

item.title: Updated XML export: resource state and reliability information now provided
item.description: The XML export and XML Schema have been updated: the current state and general reliability (provided as a percentage) of the resources are now included in the file.

item.title: Updated way to browse the data types
item.description: Updated way to browse the data types: direct access to data types which name starts by a given letter or set of letters.

item.title: MiriamJavaLib version 1.1.2
item.description: Release of the version 1.1.2 of the Java library, available from SourceForge and the EBI Maven repository.

item.title: New Web Services method: getLocationsWithToken()
item.description: Web Services updated: new method getLocationsWithToken() for retrieving generic physical locations (URLs) of web pageS providing the dataset of a given data type.

item.title: URI based identification systems comparision
item.description: New page describing the URI based identification systems currently available. If you have any information you wish to contribute, feel free to contact us.

item.title: Use of MIRIAM Guidelines and MIRIAM Resources
item.description: New page describing the current use of MIRIAM Guidelines and MIRIAM Resources. If you have any information you wish to contribute, feel free to contact us.

item.title: Search results page now bookmarkable
item.description: The search results page is now bookmarkable. For example, you can access to the results of a search for protein interaction.

item.title: MIRIAM URN/Identifier structure survey
item.description: MIRIAM URN/Identifier structure survey: please take a few minutes to look at the documentation and fill the very short survey. Thank you.

item.title: Web Services updated
item.description: Web Services updated: getURI() and getLocations() now perform a check of the validity of the identifier provided. In case it is not valid, the result returned is null. For more information about these methods, please refer to the Web Services documentation.

item.title: Java library available via EBI Maven repository
item.description: The Java library is now available via the EBI Maven repository. Cf. the library page for more details.

item.title: Deprecated resources not displayed by default
item.description: On the detail page of a data type, the deprecated resources are not displayed by default.

item.title: Nicer URLs
item.description: Access to the data is now done via shorter and nicer URLs. More details are available on the news page.

item.title: Web Services records now available
item.description: Information about Web Services provided by the various data types is now available via a fourth tab. These records will be gradually completed.

item.title: Resource health information now available
item.description: We started to perform a daily check of the health of all the resources several months ago, for maintenance purposes. Now this information is available to everybody. You just need to click on a resource identifier to access its health history. Moreover, the resources are displayed ordered by reliability.

item.title: Export of the BioModels.net qualifiers
item.description: The BioModels.net qualifiers are now available to download as an XML file and RDF file. We welcome any suggestions and comments to improve these.

item.title: Updated XML export and XML Schema
item.description: A new version of the XML export is now available, with direct access to the file XML file. This file is generated on demand, so you are sure to always get an up-to-date export.

item.title: Updated Java Library
item.description: New version of the Java library now available (download from SourceForge).

item.title: Updated SOAP Web Services
item.description: SOAP Web Services updated: various new kind of parameters now accepted by the method getOfficialDataTypeURI(). Cf. the page describing the available services for more information.

item.title: REST Web Services available (BETA)
item.description: REST Web Services are now available from http://www.ebi.ac.uk/miriamws/main/rest/ for you to test and give us feedback!

item.title: More than 100 data types in MIRIAM Resources!
item.description: More than 100 data types now in MIRIAM Resources!

item.title: New way to access the data
item.description: Various new data types have been added to the resource, cf. current list.

item.title: Update of the XML export and XML Schema
item.description: The XML export and XML Schema have been updated.

item.title: New way to access the data
item.description: Access to the record of a specific data type can now be done in an easy way: just by putting the identifier at the end of the URL. For example: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/miriam/main/MIR:00000008.

item.title: Resource Health Check System
item.description: A resource health check system has been implemented. It queries every resources in the database in order to know which ones are responsive. This is automatically launched every day. It will allow us to easily detect changes in the way to access the data and quickly update the corresponding records.

item.title: New features
item.description: As the content of the database grows, we improved the user interface for browsing and editing the data types stored. Moreover, a summary of some basic statictics of MIRIAM Resources is available on the export page which allow you to easily check if the content of the database has been updated recently.

item.title: Tags
item.description: In order to improve the user experience, we introduced tags: each data type is now associated with one or more tags. Of course, you can easily use them to search data types matching one or several concepts. Moreover, we updated the XML export (and the XML Schema) in order to provide them in the file.

item.title: Search engine
item.description: A search engine is now available to easily retrieve the data types your are looking for. The search is based on all the textual data stored about the data types, except the tags (a specific search engine is available) and the examples of annotations. It includes the information stored about the resources as well.

item.title: XML Schema updated
item.description: The XML Schema of the XML export of the content of MIRIAM Database has been updated to match the recent changes on the format. This export now includes some examples of annotation in various formats (for example SBML, BioPAX or CellML). Moreover, the format now follows a nested structure for 'uris', 'resources', 'synonyms' and 'documentations'.

item.title: New XML export
item.description: The XML export has been updated in order to contain more information. The examples of annotation in several formats (such as SBML, BioPAX or CellML) are now available in this XML file. The XML Schema has also been updated and will be available soon.

item.title: Web Services updated
item.description: MIRIAM Web Services have been updated in order to provide an easy way for users to manage the transition between the old to the new MIRIAM URIs. For example the method 'getOfficialEntryURI()' allows you to convert an old MIRIAM URI into its official one. Don't forget to download the latest Java library to use these new features.

item.title: New Scheme for MIRIAM URIs (Beta)
item.description: We released the new MIRIAM URIs, based on URN. These are more coherent and reliable than the ones used previously. In order to make the transition easier, don't forget to use the latest version of the Web Services and the associated library.

item.title: New BioModels.net qualifier: "occursIn"
item.description: New BioModels.net qualifier: "occursIn". For example: "MAP-kinase cascade occursIn human". For more information, cf. qualifiers section.

item.title: XML Schema updated
item.description: The XML Schema of the XML export of the content of MIRIAM Database has been updated to match (slight) recent changes on the format (cf. news about the DOI support in documentation).

item.title: A curator for MIRIAM Resources and the Systems Biology Ontology
item.description: A curator, Nick Juty, has been hired to work on MIRIAM Resources and the Systems Biology Ontology, as part of the European project ELIXIR.

item.title: DOI support for pieces of documentation
item.description: Pieces of documentation for a data type can now be stored using a DOI (as well as a PMID or a physical location).

item.title: New data type in MIRIAM Resources: SABIO-RK Reaction
item.description: SABIO-RK is a relational database system that contains information about biochemical reactions, their kinetic equations with their parameters, and the experimental conditions under which these parameters were measured.

item.title: Welcome to MIRIAM News Feed!
item.description: New RSS feed to keep track of what happen on MIRIAM Resources.
